apl_event.title: Open Mic. Night
apl_event.body: Join us while we celebrate Banned Book Week and freedom of speech with a night of music, poetry, and expression. You bring your voice and your art, we'll provide a piano, guitar, and microphone.

apl_event.title: Banned Camp Film Fest
apl_event.body: Join us for a screening of a film based on a banned book. Prepare to be scared! We will watch Scary Stories to Tell in the Dark (2019, PG-13), based on the horror series for children by Alvin Schwartz. As a preview, we will watch an excerpt from Scary Stories (2019, NR), a documentary about Schwartz' books. Recommended for ages 13 and up.

apl_event.title: Virtual Graphic Novel Book Club Jr.
apl_event.field_event_summary: We know there are many graphic-novel-devouring tweens out there, so come join Leslie and Jessica in discussing books each month. In August, we'll be reading the first book in the 5 Worlds series, The Sand Warrior, by Mark Siege.

apl_event.title: Bookmobile Stop
apl_event.body: Visit our bookmobile at the Northwest Recreation Center. Sign up for your library card and check out books, movies, audio books and more!

apl_event.title: Teen Banned Camp Film Fest: Persepolis
apl_event.body: This event is for teens 13-18 only. Join us for a screening of a film based on a banned book. Persepolis, and stick around to discuss the film and the current state of book challenges.

apl_event.title: Banned Camp Film Fest
apl_event.body: Join us for a family screening and art project to celebrate Banned Books Week. Speak for the trees and come by and watch The Lorax. This book was banned in 1989 from a California Public school for "brainwashing children". This movie is rated PG and is recommended for ages 9 and up.

apl_event.title: Banned Camp Film Fest
apl_event.body: Join us for a screening of a film based on a banned book. Tonight we are showing Are You There God. . . It's Me, Margaret, a film based on Judy Blume's beloved teen classic. Film is rated PG-13 and recommended for ages 13 and up.

apl_event.title: Banned Camp Make and Watch
apl_event.body: Join us for a family screening and art project to celebrate Banned Books Week. Prepare to travel across time and space with A Wrinkle in Time (2018), based on the award winning novel that was banned in some places for "promoting the occult." This movie is rated PG and runs for 109 minutes. Recommended for ages 9 and up.

apl_event.title: Banned Camp Film Fest
apl_event.body: Join us for a family screening of a film based on a banned book. Ready your spy gear for Harriet the Spy, and stick around to discuss the film and the current state of book challenges. Recommended for ages 9 and up.

apl_event.title: Banned Camp Film Fest
apl_event.body: Join us for a screening of a film based on a banned book. We will watch the 2019 documentary about the beloved, yet controversial children horror series Scary Stories to Tell in the Dark. Movie is rated PG-13 and is recommended for ages 13 and up.

apl_event.title: Banned Camp Film Fest
apl_event.body: Join us for a family screening of a film based on a banned book. Ready your spy gear for Harriet the Spy, and stick around to discuss the film and the current state of book challenges. Recommended for ages 9 and up.

apl_event.title: Banned Camp Film Fest
apl_event.body: Join us for a screening of a film based on a banned book. Howl (2010) follows the life and art of poet Allen Ginsberg, including the obscenity trial surrounding his famous poem Howl. Movie is rated R.

apl_event.title: Banned Camp Film Fest
apl_event.body: Join us for a screening of a film based on a banned book. Are You There God. . . It's Me, Margaret, and stick around to discuss the film and the current state of book challenges. Recommended for ages 13 and up.

apl_event.title: Banned Books Silent Reading Party
apl_event.body: Celebrate your freedom to read at our silent reading party. Bring your favorite book to read or borrow one of our headsets and listen to George Orwells' 1984 or Shirley Jackson's The Lottery on audiobook. Snacks and beverages will be provided while supplies last.

apl_event.title: Teen Banned Camp: Banned Book Bookclub
apl_event.body: This program is for teens age 13-18 only. Read any banned book and come discuss it with other teen book fans! We'll discuss what everyone read and why those titles were banned or challenged, and then everyone can share book titles that we should add to our TBR piles!

apl_event.title: Teen Banned Camp: Representation Matters
apl_event.body: OutYouth invites all teens who are passionate about the power of books and the importance of representation to join us for an inspiring presentation. Discover how to create your own banned book club.

apl_event.title: Teen Banned Camp: Printmaking & Zinemaking
apl_event.body: This event is for teens 13-18 only. Learn about the history of zines and printmaking, and then get your hands dirty making a print or zine on what the freedom to read means to you. All teens will be invited to submit their work for a special Banned Book issue of ATXyz - the Austin Texas Youth Zine.  Co-sponsored by the Children's Defense Fund and the Austin Public Library.

apl_event.title: Teen Banned Camp: Banned Bookclub Networking & Support
apl_event.body: This event is for teens 13-18 only. Want to learn more about what other teens are doing around book bans happening in Texas, or share your experience getting involved? Join us in this virtual meetup for teens co-sponsored by the Children's Defense Fund, BookPeople, the Library and facilitated by SEAT (Students Engaged in Advancing Texas).

apl_event.title: Teen Banned Camp: Art & Zine making Party
apl_event.body: This event is for teens 13-18 only. Join us to make a piece of art or contribute a piece of Bookmark Art for our community mural or zine projects, reflecting your views on the current conversations happening around book bans.

apl_event.title: Banned Camp Pre-Screening Trivia
apl_event.body: Join us for Banned Books trivia before a screening of A Wrinkle in Time. Compete for a prize and learn more about your freedom to read. Stick around after for the movie screening and art project.

apl_event.title: Tween Code Club
apl_event.body:
Learn to code games and animation in Scratch in this three-week series on Sundays 1-2:30 at the Little Walnut Creek branch.

Utilizing the Rasberry Pi Code Club curriculum, students will be introduced to the Scratch coding platform, create fun projects, and explore coding concepts such as scripts, loops, operators, and variables.  No experience is necessary, all levels are welcome. Please ensure you register for all three sessions in a series.

Aprenda a codificar los juegos y las animaciónes en Scratch en esta serie de tres semanas los domingos 1-2:30 en Little Walnut Creek Branch.

Utilizando el plan de estudios de Rasberry Pi, los estudiantes serán introducidos en la plataforma de codificación de Scratch, crearán proyectos divertidos y explorarán conceptos de codificación como scripts, bucles, operadores y variables. No es necesaria experiencia, todos los niveles son bienvenidos. Asegúrese de registrarse para las tres sesiones de una serie.

apl_event.field_event_summary: Enjoy stories, songs, and crafts in the garden for this outdoor storytime! Remember to bring appropriate clothing, sunscreen, and bug-spray as necessary.

apl_event.body: Learn about blackout poetry and make your own poem at our Banned Books Craftstation!

apl_event.body: Gentle Flow (Ages 8+): Body, mind and soul will align as we move with intention through gentle movement guided by breath. We will incorporate meditation

apl_event.title: DJ Set - Just for Teens - with DJ KICKIT
apl_event.body: Teens 13-18 are invited to a special teens-only DJ set with DJ KICKIT, following their workshop for teens and adults in the Innovation Lab!

apl_event.title: In-Person and Virtual YA for Adults Book Club
apl_event.body: Join us in person or online on December 7 to discuss Iron Widow by Xiran Jay Zhao.

apl_event.body: Come out for a polymer clay workshop hosted by the St. John Branch staff! We have the supplies, just bring your creativity. Adults and teens welcome!

apl_event.body: Join us in person or online on October 5 to discuss Howl by Shaun David Hutchinson.

apl_event.title: Talk Time
apl_event.body:
Talk Time is a program for English conversation practice with other English language learners and English speaking volunteers.

  • No registration is necessary.
  • The program is open to any adult who speaks some English and wants an informal and safe place to practice with others.

Participe en Talk Time: Hablemos Inglés, un programa gratis de La Biblioteca Pública de Austin, donde usted puede venir a conversar en inglés y así practicar y sentirse más seguro.

  • No es necesario registrarse.
  • Este programa se ofrece a cualquier adulto que hable algo de inglés y que quiera practicarlo con otros en un lugar informal y sin presiones.

apl_event.title: The Crafty Adult: Decorating Sugar Skulls
apl_event.body:
Decorate a sugar skull and learn about how these skulls are used in traditional altars to celebrate Day of the Dead. The class will be bilingual (Spanish). Adults only.

Decora una calavera de azúcar y aprende cómo se usan estas calaveras en los altares tradicionales para celebrar el Día de muertos. La clase será bilingüe (Español). Sólo para adultos.

apl_event.title: Rhythm and Familia Dance Class
apl_event.field_event_summary: Old and young alike will get their bodies moving while learning a simplified version of a Latin American dance! This community event is presented by the National Association of Hispanic Nurses (NAHN) Austin Chapter.

apl_event.title: Dig It! Gardening in Texas
apl_event.field_subtitle: Everything Onions, Garlic & All The Rest
apl_event.body: This October, Austin Davenport will be teaching us all about alliums! Join us in learning to grow this incredible culinary genus of plants, and come ready to get your hands dirty, because each attendee will get to leave with some garlic to grow!

apl_event.title: Sábados en Familia
apl_event.body: Sábados en Familia provides free cultural art activities created by the Mexican American Cultural Center. Participants will engage in a bilingual storytime and hands-on activities.

apl_event.title: Perler Play! Hispanic Latino Heritage Edition
apl_event.body: Create pixel art and small toys from plastic beads that fuse together when melted by an iron. | Cree pixel art y pequeños juguetes con cuentas de plástico que se fusionan cuando se derriten con una plancha.

apl_event.title: Get Crafty: Salt Watercolor Art
apl_event.body: Did you miss out on Water Art this summer? Not to worry! Drop by between 3 pm and 5 pm to make salt watercolor art with us.

apl_event.title: Medicare Information Session
apl_event.field_event_summary: Learn about the Medicare application process and get assistance from a Medicare Benefits counselor.

apl_event.title: Put out the Welcome Mat for Backyard Birds
apl_event.field_event_summary: Join us to learn more about making our yard a welcome place for birds!  Learn how to attract a diversity of expected backyard species, using native plants, water features, supplemental feeders, and nest boxes.

apl_event.title: South Austin Ukulele Strum Along
apl_event.body:
Play ukulele and sing along with popular music recordings. For players who are able to strum and play four chord songs and learn new chord as needed. Please bring your own ukulele. Presented by South Austin Ukulele Community & Events (SAUCE).

Library programs and workshops reflect the creative endeavors and diverse interests of the Austin community.

Manejo de Negocios de Repostería Casera en Texas
apl_event.body:
Curso gratuito ofrecido en español en colaboración con Open Art sobre cómo convertir la cocina de su hogar en un negocio legal en Texas.

Las clases se llevarán a cabo los martes 3, 10, 17, 24 y 31 de octubre de 10am a 1pm.

El cupo es limitado.

apl_event.title: Star Weaving with One Million Stars Texas
apl_event.body: In this workshop we will share information about the One Million Stars Texas project and participants will learn how to weave stars. Supplies will be provided.

apl_event.title: Star Weaving with One Million Stars Texas
apl_event.field_event_summary: In this workshop we will share information about the One Million Stars Texas project and participants will learn how to weave stars.  This intergenerational project is a great activity for the whole family.  Supplies will be provided.

apl_event.title: Star Weaving with One Million Stars Texas
apl_event.field_event_summary: In this workshop we will share information about the One Million Stars Texas project and participants will learn how to weave stars. Star weaving is a medium level weaving technique. All supplies will be provided.

apl_event.title: Teen Fix-It Clinic: Sewing
apl_event.body:
Teens, come learn basic sewing skills and repair damaged clothes with the help of Fix-It Clinic Volunteers! Bring clothing or other textiles you would like to fix. After a short sewing project to help you get the basics down, you will have the opportunity to work with volunteers to repair your items. All other materials provided. Registration required for this event. 

Adolescentes, vengan a aprender habilidades básicas de costura y a reparar ropa dañada con la ayuda de los voluntarios de Fix-It Clinic! Traigan ropa u otros textiles que quieras arreglar. Después de un breve proyecto de costura para ayudarte a aprender lo básico, tendrás la oportunidad de trabajar con voluntarios para reparar tus artículos. Todos los materiales para reparar son proporcionados. Se requiere inscripción para este evento.

apl_event.title: Sesión Informativa de Medicare| Medicare Information Session
apl_event.body:
Infórmese sobre el proceso de solicitud de Medicare. Obtenga asistencia de un consejero de beneficios de Medicare. 

Learn about the Medicare application process and get assistance from a Medicare benefits counselor.

apl_event.title: Baila! A Collection of Latin Dance Lessons
apl_event.body:
Latin dance reveals the ancient traditions of Latino culture as well as its history of emigration and adaptation. Offering an outlet for rhythmic expression and flowing movements, Latin dance incorporates a number of styles, including bachata, cumbia, reggaetón, salsa, and merengue.  Come watch and learn with Corazon Latino at the Library.

La danza latina revelan tradiciones ancestrales de esta cultura y habla también de su  historia de emigración y adaptación. apl_event.title: Solar Eclipse Viewer DIY Workshop
apl_event.body: Unveiling the mystery of solar eclipse and learn how to make simple solar eclipse viewers using materials you can find in daily life.

apl_event.body: Get into the Halloween spirit this October and craft your own Voodoo Doll! This month Ms. Rita will teach us to cut out, sew and stuff your own creepy/cute Voodoo Doll! Come and craft at your own risk!

apl_event.title: Dove Springs Oral History Workshop
apl_event.body:
Do you live or have you lived in Dove Springs? Are you interested in community history but not sure how to help preserve it? Learn how to conduct oral history interviews in a FREE workshop presented by the Austin History Center and Southeast Branch Library!

At this workshop you will:

  • Enjoy FREE lunch
  • Hear about resources at the Austin History Center
  • Learn the basics of oral history projects
  • Practice interviewing a friend

Questions? Contact Marina at marina.islas@austintexas.gov

apl_event.title: Eclipse Party
apl_event.body: Explore the skies and enjoy space-themed crafts and activities for all ages before viewing the annual solar eclipse. Protective glasses will be provided.

apl_event.title: Banned Book Film Fest: A Wrinkle in Time
apl_event.body: Join us for a family screening of a film based on a banned book. Prepare to travel across time and space with A Wrinkle in Time (2018), based on the award-winning novel that was banned in some places for "promoting the occult." After the movie, stick around to discuss the film and the current state of book challenges. This movie is rated PG and runs for 109 minutes. Recommended for ages 9 and up.

apl_event.title: Terrariums at Terrazas
apl_event.body:
L﻿earn how to make a terrarium and learn a little bit about how the ecosystem works both inside and outside the jar!

Attendees will make their own terrariums with supplies and plant provided.

  • The first 25 registered attendees will get a half-gallon glass jar for their terrarium.
  • Other attendees will get smaller jars to use depending on available supplies.
  • Attendees can also bring their own clean glass jars, up to a half-gallon in size, to use for the program.

Due to limited supplies families will be limited to 1 terrarium per household.
apl_event.field_event_summary: Make your first ecosystem in a jar while we walk you through the steps of making a terrarium!

apl_event.title: Baila! A Collection of Latin Dance Lessons
apl_event.body:
Latin dance reveals the ancient traditions of Latino culture as well as its history of emigration and adaptation. Offering an outlet for rhythmic expression and flowing movements, Latin dance incorporates a number of styles, including bachata, cumbia, reggaetón, salsa, and merengue.  Come watch and learn with Corazon Latino at the Library.

La danza latina revelan tradiciones ancestrales de esta cultura y habla también de su  historia de emigración y adaptación. Esta danza incorporan diversos estilos que incluyen la bachata, la cumbia, el reggaetón, la salsa y el merengue, los cuales ofrecen un conducto  para  expresiones rítmicas y movimientos fluidos. Le invitamos a las demostraciones y clases de bailes latinos ofrecidos en la Biblioteca a través de la organización Corazon Latino.

Este programa es presentado en inglés. Si necesita un intérprete, por favor solicítelo en este número: 512-974-7400.

apl_event.title: Nuestro Mundo (Our World) Teen Exhibit
apl_event.field_subtitle: All welcome to this teen art exhibition
apl_event.body:
All ages are welcome to join us for the reception of Nuestro Mundo (Our World) Teen Exhibit where we will showcase the artwork created by Austin's youth during MexicARTE's summer camp. We will have a screen printing activity, snacks and music by DJ Hierba Malita! 

In Nuestro Mundo, students focused on building and strengthening their community through art and education. Led by museum art educators, participants identified a change they wish to see in the world. Each student created an infographic poster using silkscreen printing technology. These posters communicate to the public the necessity of social change in an area of importance to our young participants.

apl_event.title: Spooky Carnival
apl_event.body: Celebrate all things spooky and scary at our Halloween Carnival for kids!  Games, crafts, activities and fun for all ages! Costumes encouraged!

apl_event.title: Arthouse Films at Terrazas - Missing (1982)
apl_event.body:
This September marks the 50th anniversary of the September 11, 1973 Chilean coup d'état. The U.S. supported military coup violently overthrew the democratic government of Chile installing a dictatorship that lasted 16 years

In commemoration, Terrazas Branch Library will be screening the1982 Palm d'Or winner "Missing"  directed by Costa-Gavras.

"A film based on the disappearance of journalist Charles Horman. A father searches for his missing son during the oppressive and violent political chaos of the 1973 Chilean coup. Seeking help from local bureau of the U.S. State Department, family frustration grows as the situation becomes more complex."

apl_event.title: Reading the Music - "Charlie’s Good Tonight” by Paul Sexton
apl_event.body:
Reading the Music is a monthly virtual book club centered on biographies of musical artists, groups, and genres.

September's book of the month is "Charlie’s Good Tonight” by Paul Sexton.

Feel free to join even if you've read or watched any other related biography/documentary, or just want to have a conversation about The Rolling Stones!

Please register on Eventbrite to attend. Using your registration info, your program moderator will email you an invitation to this virtual event.  

Registration for this event will close on 09/24/23.

apl_event.title: Arthouse Films at Terrazas
apl_event.body:
Join us for a captivating evening of Arthouse Films as we delve into the thought-provoking film "Missing" (1982)

This September is the 50th anniversary of the Chilean coup d'état of 1973. September 11, 1973 - The Chilean military violently overthrew the democratic government of Chile installing a dictatorship that lasted 16 years.

apl_event.body: Heartsong Music presents Music Together the early childhood music and movement program for children from birth through grade two and the adults who love them. Children of all ages can discover their inner music-makers through musical play!

apl_event.title: Heartsong Music presents Music Together
apl_event.body: Heartsong Music presents Music Together the early childhood music and movement program for children from birth through grade two and the adults who love them. Children of all ages can discover their inner music-makers through musical play!

apl_event.title: Controversy & Conversation – Memories of a Dreamer
apl_event.body:
September 2023 marks the 50th anniversary of the September 11th 1973 military coup in Chile that inaugurated a 17 year long military dictatorship.

Come watch a screening of the 2008 documentary “Memories of a Dreamer: The Journey of a Political Prisoner.”

“A firsthand account of the hardship suffered by a political prisoner of Chile's cruel 1973 and inhumane dictatorship. More than 30 years after, Félix Mora relives the shocking details of the human rights abuses he suffered, his escape from the dictatorship, and the challenges he faced as an exile in Italy and Canada.” *

After the film there will be a discussion between the audience and a discussant with insight on the film's subject matter.**

To learn more about topics related to this month's film make sure to explore this resource list.

2023 marks the 10th anniversary of Controversy & Conversation, a film series brought to you by Austin Public Library's Terrazas Branch. 

* (from the Official Documentary Website.)

** (discussant is TBA)

apl_event.body:
School's Out for Perlers!  We noticed that you have the day off from school, so why not have a mini-maker day? 

We'll use Perler Beads to craft fun, cute, cool, and even spooky creations. We'll also eat snacks and have good time. 

Supplies provided free of charge by the Library.

apl_event.title: CREATE!
apl_event.body:
Have you been melting this Summer? Us, too!  Let's use those temperatures for something fun!

We will make melted crayon art with outdoor warmth, heat guns, and irons. 

Please be advised that this activity could be a bit messy, so wear older clothes, if possible.

apl_event.title: Grow Green: Wild About Plants!
apl_event.body: Grow Green is a City of Austin water quality education program that encourages people to make landscaping choices that benefit the environment, emphasizing using the right plant in the right place philosophy. Central Texas climate has many extremes, so the plants have to be Texas tough! Understanding what makes them capable of surviving, the regional environment and the importance of site-specific conditions is essential to making informed plant selection decisions.

apl_event.title: All Ages Storytime
apl_event.body:
Read, sing, dance, craft, and play at All Ages Storytime. 

This one has everyone from babies to big kids, so it is great for siblings and friend groups!

apl_event.title: All Ages Storytime
apl_event.body:
Read, dance, sing, craft, and play at All Ages Storytime. 

This storytime has all ages, from babies to big kids, so it is great for siblings and friends!

apl_event.title: LEGO Lab
apl_event.body:
Come build with us! We provide lots of LEGO and you bring the creativity. 

Making at the Library is the best!  You can meet other brick fans and eat snacks, too. 

We have Duplo, LEGO, and Bionicle for building at University Hills Branch.

apl_event.title: Tea Dragon Tea Party!
apl_event.body:
Celebrate coziness and the wonderful graphic novels by K. O'Neill with an invite to our lovely tea party!

We will have books, snacks, buttons, and crafts. Come make your very own dragon egg to keep and meet others who are like-minded readers of comfy fiction.

All supplies provided free of charge by the library.

Recommended for tweens ages 9 and up.

apl_event.title: Lounge Movie Night: Style Wars
apl_event.body:
Austin Public Library's Innovate Digital Makerspace invites you to get inspired by films featuring trailblazing artists that paved the way for artistic creation.

Style Wars is a documentary that exposes the rich growing subculture of hip-hop that was developing in New York City in the late '70s and early '80s, specifically focusing on graffiti art and breakdancing.

This recurring event will happen every third Thursday of the month at the Innovation Lounge, stay tuned to see what amazing films we will be presenting next.

Also, find out how you can recreate similar art using our Digital Makerspace, located on the 5th floor of the Austin Central Library!
apl_event.field_event_summary: Austin Public Library's Innovate Digital Makerspace invites you to get inspired by films featuring trailblazing artists that paved the way for artistic creation.

apl_event.title: Pixel Perfect: Graffiti GIFS
apl_event.body:
Drop in to this Pixel Perfect workshop where we will learn to use freeware called Photopea to create digital Graffiti GIFs inspired by the Hip Hop Documentary, Style Wars! Join us in the Innovation Lounge on the 5th floor of Austin Central Library on Thursday September 28th from 5:00PM - 7:00PM.

J﻿oin us for a special Lounge Movie Night Screening of Style Wars! Happening on Thursday September 21st from 5:30PM - 8:00 PM.

Also find out how the new Innovate Digital Makerspace can help with your digital art projects!

apl_event.title: Katha: Building Storytellers
apl_event.body: In Sanskrit, "Katha" means "a story, legend, conversation, or tale." This program, in partnership with the local non-profit Peerbagh, introduces South-Asia inspired inclusive storytelling and creative writing workshops through six one-hour weekly sessions, specifically designed for kids from 9-14 years old. Kids will gain the creative confidence and tools to tell a story authentically, while being exposed to South-Asian literature in a fun and engaging way!

apl_event.title: The Crafty Adult: Felt Marigold Flowers
apl_event.body:
Join us for a Hispanic Latino Heritage Month event creating felt Marigold flowers that represent the brevity of life and are an essential element of the Day of Dead. Registration is required.  Supplies are limited.

Acompáñenos en este evento que celebra el mes de la Hispanidad. Haremos flores de cempasúchil de fieltro, las cuales representan la brevedad de la vida y son elementos esenciales durante las celebraciones del Día de los Muertos. Reservaciones obligatorias. Este es un programa solo para adultos. Los suministros son limitados.

Este programa es presentado en inglés. Si necesita un intérprete, por favor solicítelo en este número: 512-974-7400.

apl_event.title: Artist Talk with Kollective Fusion
apl_event.body: Artist Talk with Kollective Fusion: Coinciding with the 50th year of Hip Hop, APLs first hip-hop-themed poster exhibition will be traveling from the Austin History Center to multiple branches throughout the Austin Public Library. The hip hop poster artist, founder of KLCTIVE and Creative Director at Industry Print Shop, Bobby Dixon will share his insights and creation ideas of his work with attendees. Come mingle with the artist and other hip hop art enthusiasts!

apl_event.title: Get Crafty: Banned Books Lockets and Magnets
apl_event.body:
Throughout history, many books in schools and libraries around the country have become cases for contention surrounding controversial topics in a variety of iconic pieces of literature.

Join us at the Windsor Branch Library as we explore the meaning of banned books in America and create lockets, magnets and buttons that represent books that have been banned throughout history in America.

apl_event.title: Canceled - Terrariums at Terrazas
apl_event.body:
L﻿earn how to make a terrarium and learn a little bit about how the ecosystem works both inside & outside the jar.

Attendees will make their own terrariums with supplies and moss provided.

Since supplies are limited only the first 12 registered attendees will get a half-gallon glass jar for their terrarium.

Other attendees will get smaller jars to use depending on available supplies. Limit 2 terrarium library provided jars per household.

Attendees can also bring their own clean glass jars, up to a half-gallon in size, to use for the program.

apl_event.body:

apl_event.title: Author Talk: Latinx Pop Culture Matters! with Professor Frederick Luis Aldama
apl_event.body: Professor Frederick Luis Aldama, aka Professor Latinx, will unzip his brain, offering a performative multimedia extravaganza of all things Latinx pop culture in the 21st century. This includes an exploration of how contemporary mainstream pop culture simplifies and straightjackets Latinx identity and experience. He will then contrast this with today’s abundance of Latinx created pop culture that vitally complicates and enriches our understanding of Latinx identity and experience.  Along the way Aldama will present a dynamic model for understanding Latinx subjects as active transformers of the world we live in today.

apl_event.title: Get Crafty: Guatemalan Barrilete Gigantes Kites
apl_event.body:
Join us for this special hands-on workshop to make traditional Guatemalan Barrilete Gigantes kites to celebrate el Dia de los Muertos (Day of the Dead). We will be making Mini Guatemalan Kites and learning about the ancient art form. 

Acompáñenos en este taller práctico sobre los tradicionales barriletes gigantes guatemaltecos que se construyen para celebrar el Día de los Muertos (Day of the Dead.) Haremos barriletes en miniatura y aprenderemos sobre esta forma de arte ancestral.

apl_event.title: Talk Time
apl_event.body:
Talk Time is a program for English conversation practice with other English language learners and English speaking volunteers.

  • No registration is necessary.
  • The program is open to any adult who speaks some English and wants an informal and safe place to practice with others.

Participe en Talk Time: Hablemos Inglés, un programa gratis de La Biblioteca Pública de Austin, donde usted puede venir a conversar en inglés y así practicar y sentirse más seguro.

  • Este programa se ofrece a cualquier adulto que hable algo de inglés y que quiera practicarlo con otros en un lugar informal y sin presiones.

apl_event.title: Central Library Concert: Latin Dukes
apl_event.body: Join us for a live acoustic set by Austin's own Latin Dukes, who play an eclectic blend of Latin music, drawing influences from Madrid to Habana and beyond.

apl_event.title: Art Smart: Where Are You From?
apl_event.body:
A story telling program about “Family, Memories, and Multi-generations”; with songs, books, flannel-story, and shadow puppet show.

Followed by an art activity ‘My family button tree’ or ‘Paleta puppet’.

apl_event.title: Art Smart: Where Are You From?
apl_event.body:
A story telling program about “Family, Memories, and Multi-generations”; with songs, books, flannel-story, and shadow puppet show.

Followed by an art activity ‘My family button tree’ or ‘Paleta puppet’.

apl_event.title: Virtual Graphic Novel Book Club Jr.
apl_event.field_event_summary: In September, we'll be reading Oh My Gods! by Stephanie Cooke and Juliana Moon. When Karen leaves home to spend time with her father, she starts school not realizing her classmates are gods and goddesses.

apl_event.title: Virtual Graphic Novel Book Club
apl_event.field_subtitle: She-Hulk by Charles Soule & Javier Pulid
apl_event.field_event_summary: In September, we'll be reading She-Hulk: The Complete Collection by Charles Soule and Javier Pulido. When she loses her job, Jessica Walters opens up her own law practice, specializing in superhuman cases.

apl_event.title: The Austin Hip Hop Honors Awards
apl_event.body:
In honor of the 50th Anniversary of Hip Hop the Austin History Center will recognize Austin Hip Hop performing artists. The Austin Public Library System has been selected as the only library in Texas to collaborate with the Queens Public Library’s IMLS grant.

Honorees Include:

Bavu Blakes

Cooly Girls

DJ Cassanova

FLOMOB

Hip Hop Mecca

MC Overlord

Mirage The Gr8

NOOK Turner

Stanley Cobble

Tee Double

apl_event.title: Zine Night
apl_event.body: This month our theme is Barbie-core.
apl_event.field_event_summary: Learn how to make and craft a zine with the Austin Public Library! Join us and fellow creators to make a zine, participate in our community zine, and add them to the Austin Public Library Zine Collection.

apl_event.title: Talk Time
apl_event.body:
Improve your English conversation. ¡Mejore su conversación en inglés!

Talk Time is a program for English conversation practice with other English language learners and English speaking volunteers. No registration is necessary. The program is open to any adult who speaks some English and wants an informal and safe place to practice with others.

Participe en Talk Time: Hablemos Inglés, un programa gratis de La Biblioteca Pública de Austin, donde usted puede venir a conversar en inglés y así practicar y sentirse más seguro. No es necesario registrarse. Este programa se ofrece a cualquier adulto que hable algo de inglés y que quiera practicarlo con otros en un lugar informal y sin presiones.

apl_event.field_event_summary: Are you ready to embark on an eco-friendly journey right from your home? Join us for an engaging and informative Composting Class led by the knowledgeable Noelle Bugaj.

apl_event.field_event_summary: Are you interested in learning more about robotics and STEM!? Join us as we explore how robots work and what robotics teams do! This workshop is presented by the Vandegrift Viperbots Robotics team.

apl_event.body: Join us as we take a closer look into the 2017 blockbuster film “Kong: Skull Island”
apl_event.field_event_summary: Take a closer look at popular films to learn about the many different aspects of filmmaking.

apl_event.field_event_summary: Sábados en Familia provides free cultural art activities created by the Mexican American Cultural Center. Participants will engage in a bilingual storytime and hands-on activities.

apl_event.field_event_summary: BizOpen: Commercial Property Requirements will cover the following: development assessment, land use and zoning, site plan review, building plans and permits, inspections and certificate of occupancy.

apl_event.title: Let's Play Go!
apl_event.field_event_summary: Are you a big fan of board games? The game of Go, also known as Weiqi, I-go or Baduk, is one of the oldest strategy games in the world! Join this information session offered by Austin Go Club to learn all the rules from a Go Master in two hours.

apl_event.field_event_summary: Our Japanese-English story time includes picture books and songs from Japan introduced in Japanese and English. Participants also get to learn about seasonal events in Japan and its history. Make & Take crafts for fun followed by the stories!

apl_event.title: Craft Together: Perler Beads
apl_event.field_event_summary: No theme, no requirements, just crafts. All you'll need to make a Perler bead masterpiece will be available in our meeting room. Use a template or create something from your imagination. All ages welcome!!

apl_event.title: Rescheduled - Baby Disco Dance Party
apl_event.field_event_summary: Put on your dancing shoes and twirliest outfit to join us for a neon baby disco complete with lights, bubbles, and a glitzy VIB area. Limited to babies 0-18 months. Tickets available 30 minutes before program.

apl_event.title: Holistic Wellness Program - Cooking Demo: High Protein
apl_event.body:
In partnership with the Emma S. Barrientos - Mexican American Cultural Center the Austin Public Library is hosting a series of free workshops and classes designed to promote holistic wellness for adults in our community.

**Pre-registration required by Mon, August 7 at Noon; please email maccwellness@austintexas.gov**
apl_event.field_event_summary: This diet is when 20% or more of your total daily calories comes from proteins like lean beef, poultry, pork, salmon, tuna, eggs, and soy. Learn how to make a quick and healthy high-protein meal using products found at your local grocery store.

apl_event.title: Making Comics Workshop
apl_event.field_event_summary: Join us the 2nd Thursday of the month for a workshop about making comics. Will draw and discuss all about making comics, from developing story ideas, to understanding panel layout, composition and more. Drawing materials will be provided.

apl_event.title: Sketch Crew
apl_event.field_event_summary: This is a drawing meet-up for artista and illustrators, to come out and draw among peers, discuss, techniques and share idea or just draw.

apl_event.title: Get Crafty: Pirate Day Edition
apl_event.field_event_summary: ARRR! It's Talk Like a Pirate Day! Come create pirate-themed crafts, such as spyglasses, pirate hats, and treasure maps.

apl_event.title: 50 Years of Hip Hop feat. Bavu Blakes & Anastasia Hera
apl_event.body:
To celebrate the 50th anniversary of hip hop music and culture, Classic Hip Hop Live is performing at ACC. This event will feature Bavu Blakes & Anastasia Hera. 

ACC Highland Campus, Bldg. 2000, Recital Hall (6101 Highland Campus Drive)

apl_event.title: Talk Time
apl_event.body:
Talk Time is a program for English conversation practice with other English language learners and English speaking volunteers.

  • No registration is necessary.
  • The program is open to any adult who speaks some English and wants an informal and safe place to practice with others.

Participe en Talk Time: Hablemos Inglés, un programa gratis de La Biblioteca Pública de Austin, donde usted puede venir a conversar en inglés y así practicar y sentirse más seguro.

  • No es necesario registrarse.
  • Este programa se ofrece a cualquier adulto que hable algo de inglés y que quiera practicarlo con otros en un lugar informal y sin presiones.
